definition: Scott (name)/Sir Walter Scott (1771-1832), Scottish romantic novelist
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: It meant she knew Scott would not be able to write.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着她知道司各特这样就不能握笔写作了。

sentences.english: We all doubted Scott was responsible for breaking the window.
sentences.chinese: 咱们都思疑司各特应当对打破窗户玻璃负责。

sentences.english: Roeder later interrupted Wilbert several times as the judge pronounced sentence.
sentences.chinese: 后来法官宣布判决结果时，司各特又打断了法官几次。

sentences.english: This time I found a refuge in the household of Dr. Scott.
sentences.chinese: 这一次我在司各特博士的家里找到一个庇护所。

sentences.english: Scott loves to crunch numbers, so he has decided to become an accountant.
sentences.chinese: 司各特喜欢演算，因此他决定要成为会计。

sentences.english: The wind blew a branch against Scott's front window.
sentences.chinese: 风把一根树枝刮到了司各特的窗户上。

sentences.english: VOA White House correspondent Scotts Stone reports.
sentences.chinese: 美国之音驻白宫记者司各特斯通报道。

sentences.english: Scott is now boning up on mathematics and physics for the coming examinations.
sentences.chinese: 司各特现在正为即将来临的考试努力研读数学和物理。

sentences.english: Scott was very much in love with Zelda and he was very jealous of her.
sentences.chinese: 司各特非常爱恋姗尔达，他非常妒忌她。

sentences.english: Scott closed the door and took her in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 司各特关了门把她拥在怀里。

definition: William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Melville (name)/Herman Melville (1819-1891), US novelist, author of Moby Dick 白鯨|白鲸[bai2 jing1]
James Joyce (1882-1941), Irish modernist writer, author of Ulysses and Finnegans Wake
pinyin: Zhan1 mu3 si1 · Qiao2 yi1 si1

definition: Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
